overview:
## Discussion

Read this environment value from within a view to obtain the preferred visibility for labels within the hierarchy. If you would like to dynamically hide the label of your custom view, make sure to include an accessibility label via the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/accessibilityLabel(content:)] modifier as illustrated below:

items.description: Hides the labels of any controls contained within this view.
items.name: labelsHidden()

items.description: Controls the visibility of labels of any controls contained within this view.
items.name: labelsVisibility(_:)

items.description: Sets the menu indicator visibility for controls within this view.
items.name: menuIndicator(_:)

items.description: Sets the visibility of the status bar.
items.name: statusBarHidden(_:)

items.description: Sets the preferred visibility of the non-transient system views overlaying the app.
items.name: persistentSystemOverlays(_:)

items.description: The visibility of a UI element, chosen automatically based on the platform, current context, and other factors.
items.name: Visibility

title: labelsVisibility
